title: Waste Management Business Helps Food Security - Kompas.id
text: [›](/) [English](/kategori/english)›Waste Management Business... Waste Management Business Helps Food Security Waste management business players continue to innovate with the latest technology that adds more value. About AI Translated Article Please note that this article was automatically translated using Microsoft Azure AI, Open AI, and Google Translation AI. We cannot ensure that the entire content is translated accurately. If you spot any errors or inconsistencies, contact us at [hotline@kompas.id](mailto:hotline@kompas.id), and we'll make every effort to address them. Thank you for your understanding. Indonesia is a potential market for waste management businesses. Apart from the large amount of waste that has not been managed properly, [waste processing](https://www.kompas.id/label/pengolahan-sampah?open_from=automate_body_url) technology is able to produce a lot of added value, including for the livestock and fishing industries. The National Waste Management Information System (SIPSN) data from the Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK) reported that the amount of waste produced from all over Indonesia reached 35.83 million tons in 2022. Of that amount, 13.39 million tons or 37.37 percent have not been managed.
